text: Arnulf of Carinthia ( 850 â€“ December 8, 899) was the duke of Carinthia who removed his uncle, Emperor Charles the Fat from power. He was the disputed King of Italy from 894 and the disputed Holy Roman Emperor from February 22, 896 until his death at Regensburg, Bavaria. ==References== Category:850 births Category:899 deaths Category:Kings and Queens in Germany Category:Kings and Queens of Italy Category:Holy Roman Emperors Category:9th century in Germany
title: Arnulf of Carinthia
